It's right side up, but it's a motif rather than a mei.  The radical for th=
e first kanji is usually used for insects and some reptiles (no doubt other=
 things, too)... it looks somewhat like cho (butterfly) =E8=9D=B6.  I'm sur=
e that there are a lot of insect names that don't appear in our general J-E=
 kanji dictionaries.  The second kanji is sukashi=E9=80=8F.  What does the =
motif on the tsuba look like?

Jim 



  This was on the lid of a tsuba box=
 which arrived with tsuba inside today.  <sigh> I can't recognize any kanji=
 as these in my copy of Nelson. (And I will be really embarassed if I scann=
ed the image upside down.)

  http://zincavage.org/TsubaBox.html
